questions.question: What does the chmod 644 filename command do?

options.a: Sets read/write for owner, read for group and others

questions.question: To change the priority of a running process in Unix/Linux, which command is used?
In a CPU with a 2 GHz clock and a CPI of 3, how many cycles are required to execute 100 million instructions?
What does the command 'cut -d: -f2 file.txt' do?

options.a: Cuts the second field of each line in file.txt.
options.b: Cuts lines containing the second field in file.txt.
options.c: Cuts the delimiter ':' from each line in file.txt.
options.d: Cuts the first field of each line in file.txt.

questions.question: A CPU generates 36-bit virtual addresses and has a 4 KB page size. How many bits are used for the page number?
If a cache miss occurs 5% of the time and cache access takes 10 ns, while main memory access takes 100 ns, what is the effective access time?
To sort the lines of a text file in reverse order, which command is used?
What does the command 'wc -w file.txt' display?

options.d: Number of whitespace-separated strings in file.txt.

questions.question: To display the first few lines of a text file, which command is used?

What will be the result of the following code?
int a = 2, b = 3, c = 0;  
c = a++ || --b && ++a;  
printf("%d %d %d\n", a, b, c);

What will the following code snippet output?
int i = 0;  
for (;;) {  
    if (i == 3)  
        break;  
    printf("%d ", i);  
    i++;  
}

What will be printed by this code?

int main() {  
    int x = 0, y = 10;  
    for (x = 0; x < y; x++) {  
        if (x % 2 == 0) {  
            continue;  
        }  
        printf("%d ", x);  
    }  
    printf("%d ", x);  
    return 0;  
}

What will be the output of this code?

int x = 0;  
void increment() {  
    static int x = 0;  
    x++;  
    printf("%d ", x);  
}  
int main() {  
    increment();  
    increment();  
    increment();  
    printf("%d\n", x);  
    return 0;  
}

What is the output of the following program?

void main() {  
    int i;  
    for (i = 0; i < 5; i++) {  
        if (i % 2 == 0)  
            continue;  
        printf("%d ", i);  
    }  
    printf("%d ", i);  
}

What will be the output of this code?

int main() {  
    int arr[3] = {1, 2, 3};  
    printf("%d\n", 2[arr]);  
    return 0;  
}

What will be the output of this code?

void func(char *str) {  
    str++;  
    printf("%c\n", *str);  
}  
int main() {  
    char str[] = "Hello";  
    func(str);  
    return 0;  
}

What is the output of the following program?

void main() {  
    int i = 0;  
    for (; i < 5; i++) {  
        printf("%d ", i);  
    }  
    printf("%d ", i);  
}
Which type of coupling indicates a strong interdependence between software modules?

What is the output of the following program?

void main() {  
    int x = 5;  
    int *ptr = &x;  
    printf("%p", ptr);  
}

options.b: Address of x in hexadecimal format

questions.question: What is the purpose of a "defect tracking system" in software development?

options.a: To track the time spent on coding
options.d: To log and manage software defects

questions.question: Which of the following statements about friend functions is false?

options.a: They can access private and protected members of the class.
options.b: They must be declared in the class whose members they access.

questions.question: What does the keyword 'static' mean when applied to a member variable of a class?

options.a: It can only be accessed within the class.
options.b: It belongs to the class rather than any object.

questions.question:
What will the following code snippet output?

typedef double DoubleArray[3];
int main() {
    DoubleArray arr = {1.1, 2.2, 3.3};
    std::cout << arr[1] << std::endl;
    return 0;
}

What will the output of the following code?

using namespace std;
class A {
public:
    A() {
        cout << "A ";
    }
};
class B : public A {
public:
    B() {
        cout << "B ";
    }
};
int main() {
    B obj;
    return 0;
}

What will the output of the following code?

using namespace std;
class A {
public:
    A() {
        cout << "A ";
    }
};
class B : public A {
public:
    B() {
        cout << "B ";
    }
};
class C : public B {
public:
    C() {
        cout << "C ";
    }
};
int main() {
    C obj;
    return 0;
}

What will the output of the following code?

using namespace std;
class A {
public:
    A() {
        cout << "A ";
    }
};
class B : public A {
public:
    B() {
        cout << "B ";
    }
};
int main() {
    A* arr[2];
    arr[0] = new A;
    arr[1] = new B;
    for (int i = 0; i < 2; ++i) {
        arr[i]->print();
    }
    return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following code?

using namespace std;
class A {
public:
    virtual void display() {
        cout << "A ";
    }
};
class B : public A {
public:
    void display() override {
        cout << "B ";
    }
};
int main() {
    A obj;
    obj.display();
    return 0;
}

What will be the output of the following code?

using namespace std;
class A {
public:
    virtual void func() {
        cout << "A ";
    }
};
class B : public A {
public:
    void func() override {
        cout << "B ";
    }
};
int main() {
    B b;
    A* aptr = &b;
    aptr->func();
    return 0;
}

What will the following code print?

using CharPtr = char*;
int main() {
    char str[] = "Hello";
    CharPtr p = str;
    std::cout << p << std::endl;
    return 0;
}
Which stage of the software development process involves translating system requirements into a programming language?
Consider a relation with the following attributes: Employee(EID, Name, Salary, DeptID). If you want to find the average salary of employees in each department, which SQL query would you use?

options.a: SELECT DeptID, AVG(Salary) FROM Employee GROUP BY DeptID;
options.c: SELECT DeptID, SUM(Salary)/COUNT(EID) FROM Employee GROUP BY DeptID;
